Apparatus criticus

Previous editions are Manganaro's ed. pr. in PP 1989, and Dubois in IGDS II no. 57 (whose Line 1 is Line 3 of this text). This text and the apparatus are copied from Souza 2016 in ZPE; [...---], M.
Line.2: [---], M.
Line.3: [---.....] ἐνέοντα, M.; [---..] ἐνέοντα, D.
Line.4: [---....]nome femm. gen.[.]ᾶς Σωσία χήρας .[...?........], M.; [..............]ᾶς, D.
Line.5: [........---...]ικλῆς, M.; Παραγ[....], M.; D. omits Παραγ although it is clearly preserved.
Line.6: [---.....?].νος, M.; [...]ησις, M.; Καλ., M.; D. omits the letters before Φιλῖνος and the letters after Θέωνος.
Line.7: [---.....?]λίδα .οργ.ας Παρμ..[.]μου, Ἡρακλείδας Θε.[.....], M. and D. (who however omits the letters before .οργ.ας).
Line.8: [---] at the beginning of the line, M. and D.; Θ.ύδωρος, M. and D.
Line.10: Neither M. nor D. prints these letters, which are inscribed roughly 1.5 the size of the other letters, and centered in the middle of the line.

English translation

...the things contained on the estate...from ?, the widow of Sosias...-kles son of Herakleios, Herakleios son of Philonidas, Parag-...son of -en, Philinos son of Dionysios, -esis son of Theon, Kall-...son of -lidas, Gorgias son of Parmonimos, Herakleidas son of The-..., Pausanias son of Ariston, Theudoros son of Leontis.
